column4: hi i dowloaded ubuntu for AMD64 but one thing is confusing me... i got 2 files on my desktop, the first one is a .iso (698 MB) and the second one is a .part file (~60MB), why?
ah! now i remember... one download got broken
so the only file i need is the .iso file? i'll delete the .part file then
okay. i'll re-download it just to be sure i get a working one :P
okay i'll take a look at "down them all"
really?
thats cool =)
indeed
are you using firefox?
yes
the download either broke or is not finished. press ctrl+j and look at your downloads
firefox seems to always create the main file, and then a .part file for the same thing
if the file is still there, then it means it is not done or did not finish properly, I recommend redownloading it if it is done
I recommend getting a download accelerator (I use Down them all)
it makes the download go REALLY fast, too
yes, it spilts the download into about 5 parts and downloads them individually at the same time
what's the name of the download accelerator you was talking about?
down them all
look up dTa. It is harder to set up than, say, Free Download Manager, but once you get it going, it is better
thats what it is called shorthand, i dunno what else it might mean...
i've downloaded and installed dTa now, do i need to do any especial settings to make it work 100%?
nope. If you right click there should be the options for DTA. Also, when you download something, firefox will ask you if you wanna use downthemall or not
